content.raw:
Please note that this naming scheme is not allowed by Debian. Only libraries have development packages. Applications (gazebo) relies eventually on a library (libgazebo1 -> note the ABI versioning) which itself can be used in a 3rd party packages through its development package (libgazebo-dev -> note that the ABI versioning is disappearing here).

I can't find the official statement in the Debian Policy (http://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-sharedlibs.html) but you can observe that the development packages are introduced as a subsection of the "Shared Libraries" section.
